member.name: P:WpfApplication1.My.Resources.Resources._0_1___FightLose
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to The #creature# approaches you, almost out of nowhere.
You feel inadequately skilled to fight them.
Hefting your weapon, you charge forward, the #creature# simply brushes you aside.
.

member.name: P:WpfApplication1.My.Resources.Resources._1_1___WelcomeScreen
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to (Set Up 'start' and 'lore' buttons)
Welcome to 'Battle of the Texts', a text based game made by Matt and Will.
==========================================================================
Here you will enter the world of Raen, a world ravanged by decades of war.
Do you have what it takes to save Raen.
You can click 'start' to begin
or
Click 'lore' to read up on everything that's happened so far..

member.name: P:WpfApplication1.My.Resources.Resources._1_2___Lore

member.name: P:WpfApplication1.My.Resources.Resources._2_1___Intro
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to (NExt button to 2.2) The world is foggy around you, yet you dont notice. Objects materialize around you, yet nothing seems wrong. Your suddenly at your home, in your bed, this doesnt seem odd to you.
Sitting up, you look around, "Today's the day." you realise, this is when you head to the Capital. To join the other Chosen, to fight the Shadows. You take a step to the door, opening it, light floods around you.
.

member.name: P:WpfApplication1.My.Resources.Resources._2_2___Intro
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to You hear sounds, the crackle of a fire, the blowing of the wind; You feel ground underneath you, you're lying down?
Opening your eyes, and sitting up, a rocky outcrop surrounds you, your camp.
Your camp... what's there to say? It's a dusty, rocky patch of ground filled with a simple campfire, bedroll, and assorted supplies.
This has been your home for the better part of the month, where you've been stationed to watch for incoming Shadow forces that might threatern the Capital.
.
